perturbation.original_text: The White Hat Parties shall provide written evidence of the votes made in accordance with the foregoing sentence to the Company no later than ten business days before the 2020 Annual Meeting.
perturbation.changed_text: The White Hat Parties shall provide written evidence of the votes made in accordance with the foregoing sentence to the Company no later than five business days after the 2020 Annual Meeting.
perturbation.explanation: This creates a contradiction. Originally, the White Hat Parties had to provide evidence *before* the meeting. Now, they provide it *after*. This makes it unclear when the Company should expect the evidence and if the votes influenced the outcome.

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement may not be assigned without the prior written consent of the other Party hereto.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement may be assigned by the Company to any of its subsidiaries without the prior written consent of the White Hat Parties. However, The White Hat Parties may not assign this Agreement without the prior written consent of the Company.
perturbation.explanation: This creates an in-text contradiction and imbalance. One party (the Company) has the right to assign the agreement in certain situations without consent, while the other (White Hat Parties) always needs consent. This disparity contradicts the implied mutual obligation and can create legal uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text: The Company shall reimburse the White Hat Parties for their out-of-pocket expenses, including the fees and expenses of counsel, incurred in connection with their engagement with the Company, the Nominations and the negotiation of, and all matters arising under this Agreement; provided, however, that such reimbursement shall not exceed $55,000.
perturbation.changed_text: The Company shall reimburse the White Hat Parties for their out-of-pocket expenses, including the fees and expenses of counsel, incurred in connection with their engagement with the Company, the Nominations and the negotiation of, and all matters arising under this Agreement; provided, however, that such reimbursement shall not exceed $55,000. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Company's total reimbursement obligation under this section shall not exceed $25,000.
perturbation.explanation: This creates conflicting reimbursement limits. One part of the section states the limit is $55,000, while another part states it's $25,000. This contradiction introduces ambiguity about the actual reimbursement amount and creates a potential dispute.
